conclusion: The problem involves measuring the car's acceleration from the start using an x-t graph.
The graph shows a straight line starting from the origin with a slope of 10 m/s.
The slope of the x-t graph represents the velocity of the car.
The initial velocity of the car is 10 m/s as depicted by the slope of the graph.
Acceleration can be calculated by determining the change in velocity over time.
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 10 m/sÂ².
